subject: Gardening
title: The Potato That Fed Europe
description: A quick, practical guide to The Potato That Fed Europe.

hook.text: Europeans thought potatoes were poisonous for 200 years. Then the potato became the continent's staple food.

buildup.text: Spanish conquistadors brought potatoes from Peru to Europe in the 1570s. Most people refused to eat them.

discovery.text: Frederick the Great of Prussia forced peasants to grow potatoes. France's Parmentier promoted them with a PR stunt.

twist.text: Ireland's dependence on a single potato variety led to the Great Famine of 1845â€”killing one million people.

climax.text: The potato's story is a lesson in both the power and danger of depending on a single crop variety.

punchline.text: One root fed a continentâ€”then nearly destroyed one.

quiz.question: What caused the Irish Potato Famine of 1845?
options: A drought that lasted three consecutive years
Dependence on a single potato variety vulnerable to blight
British export of all Irish potatoes to England
